column5: Go up to the Red lake and Gullrock lake area. Drive the extra miles. Stay away from the Perrault/indian chain lake area. Not as good as further north in more remote locations. Fished them both for 40 years now. There is a difference. Gramps was a bush pilot in north Ontario. He knew a lot of folks and a lot of good fishing spots. Also....how is Clay lake doing anyway. I remember long ago it had a high mercury levels because of logging? How is that these days. Use to be good friends with the owners long long ago. Gettings owned the spot. Fished from like 77-82.
Fisherman's Cove on Lac Seul. I've been going there for over 20 years. Very well maintained, nice marina and competitive prices. -Steve
Obabikon Bay Camp out of Morson on Lake of the Woods. Absolutely exceptional walleye fishing.

I will second Bills choice with O'Sullivan's - Nakina. Kind of hard to get on list as they are usually booked but openings do occur. Very good fishing, great owners and awesome lake. We drive from Wausau, WI and is about 14 hour drive but well worth it. Good Luck
Check your private message
Whitewing Resort on Lac Seul. Very nice, well maintained camp with great owners. The fishing is awesome.
Try Gow-Bush-Kon Lodge in Gowganda, great walleye fishing lots of smallies.

Check out Snake Falls Camp on Pakwash - between Ear Falls and Red Lake. Great Walleye, Northern, and Smallmouth fishing. Camp is well protected with lake or river fishing at your doorstep. Awesome cabins. The owners - Rob and Nancy - will take care of you.

Thanks for all the suggestions. They all look like great places. To narrow it down a little, anyone know of drive to or boat in camp with less than 8 cabins, no RV sites, few (if any) other camps on the lake, and consistently good walleye fishing? We're basically looking for somewhere quiet and secluded that doesn't require the expense of flying in. Thanks in advance!
Lukinto Lake Lodge @ Longlac, ON. 8-9 cabins, NO RV's. You are able to fish a dozen or so lakes with very little fishing pressure on them.http://www.lukintolakelodge.com

I second Wally, Visit Whitewing Resort and Floating Lodges on Lac Suel, family run, good equipment, clean cabins, but most important it comes with many walleye and northern. Dave and Bobbie run a nice resort!www.whitewingresort.com
What area are you considering going to? Where are you driving from?
We're from Wisconsin. Northwest Ontario over to Nakina area.
Lac Suel Onaway
O'Sullivan's Rainbow, on O'Sullivan Lake, near Nakina. Check out their web site for more info. osullivansrainbow.com I have no financial ties to the camp, just a great place to go. Bill
Looking for a small drive-in or boat-in camp (housekeeping) that has great walleye fishing. Any suggestions?
Vermilion Bay Lodge on Eagle Lake or Indian lake lodge on the Indian lake chain, both have web sites and come HIGHLY recommended!
Milesbay camp or grassy narrows on lake of the woods out of morson. Farther north cedar point resort on cedar lake near perrualt falls.
PM sent
Birch Dale Lodge on Eagle Lake www.birchdalelodge.com 807-227-5262 owners name is Marcel.
Clark's Northern lights resort on Cedar lake or Clark's on the Indian chain. http://clarksresorts.com
North Star on Clay Lake. Drive to, yet remote no other commercial camps on that lake. Great fishing. Lots of spots so you're never crowded.
Witch Bay Camp! About a hour south of Kenora.
Procyk's on Gullrock Lake ON consistently good Walleye fishing. Camp and equipment kept in good shape.
Bowers Frog Rapids Camp in Sioux Lookout. On the English river with access to Minnitaki, Abrams and Pelican Lakes. Short drive to Lac Suel.
